duties_responsibilities.duty: Maintains and enhances client relationships by executing proactive contact initiatives, providing strategic planning and consulting advice, and reviewing investment options, services, fees, and goals.
Consults with clients to review large claims, abnormal utilization results, and monthly claims experience.
Issues profitability assists on all fee-at-risk proposals and coordinates market selection for new and renewal business on designated accounts.
Generates new business opportunities through cross-selling and negotiates program terms and costs.
Helps coordinate day-to-day administrative activities among those servicing the client’s account and provides information and techniques to department associates to improve working knowledge.
Mentors and trains junior-level staff and researches industry trends, product development, and government regulations.
Performs other responsibilities and duties as needed.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration or related field and/or years of experience equivalent (Master's preferred)
